result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHRISTOPHER DANIEL SORROW

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
Defendant CHRISTOPHER DANIEL SORROW appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for CHRISTOPHER DANIEL SORROW.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Ann Stauber Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in compliance with Marsy's Law/Victim Rights.   Competency report on filed.  Defendant in agreement with report and claims to be incompetent.  Court finds probable cause.   Court finds defendant not competent, but likely to become competent within the statutory time period. Court orders defendant committed to the DHS for a period not to exceed 12 months.   Defendant to receive 52 days credit.  Sheriff to transport.
Tickler Review Date scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 07:45 am.
Further proceedings on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Further proceedings on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Competency Report by Dr. Brandon Reintjes
Emailed to DHSS and Adam Oldenburg

9:11 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER DANIEL SORROW appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ty Gasparek in court for CHRISTOPHER DANIEL SORROW.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony Prekop in court for the State of Wisconsin. Competency questioned by Attorney Gasparek.  Court finds probable cause found and will order competency examination. Case will be sent to Branch 4 for further proceedings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present to make a statement. Record closed @ 9:13
